description: Average transport distances per transportation mode (i.e. truck, rail, water) for the commodity 'Other Non-Metallic Minerals not elsewhere classified'. Commodity categories are defined according to the Standard Classification of Transported Goods (SCTG). The SCTG code for 'Other Non-Metallic Minerals not elsewhere classified' is '13'. Specific commodities that are included in each category can be found in the SCTG Commodity Code Manual which is referenced in the methodology document. The system boundaries for these processes are manufacturing or wholesale gate to consumer. Data are sourced from the 2017 Commodity Flow Survey Public Use File. These data represent U.S. average shipment characteristics per commodity. These data are intended to model transportation of domestically transported and consumed goods. Shipment data for commodities that were ultimately exported from the United States were not included.

processDocumentation.completenessDescription: This process contains no elementary flows. All transportation modes included in the CFS data for each commodity are included.
processDocumentation.dataCollectionDescription: Data from the 2017 CFS PUF were accessed in Q4 of 2025. These data will remain unchanged. The CFS data are updated with each census but are released as separate data sets.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Data were retrieved for all available commodities.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Estimation of the total mass of each commodity shipped per transportation mode was completed based on the 2017 CFS PUF User Guide instructions. Estimation of average shipment distance for each commodity transport mode was completed based on the 2017 CFS PUF User Guide instructions. The shipment distances produced based on the calculation from the 2017 CFS PUF User Guide are weighted based on the mass fraction of the mass of commodity shipped by each mode. A more detailed discussion of the methodology is included in the methodology document.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This process represents the average U.S. shipment for the commodity.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: This process is intended to provide representative mixes of transportation for commodities in the US.
processDocumentation.inventoryMethodDescription: Not applicable; this process contains only technosphere flows. This process contains the mixture of transport processes used to model transport of a specific commodity moved within the U.S.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: Approaches to compile and estimate average transport practices for U.S. commodities from Commodity Flow Survey data are described in the linked methodology document. Transportation technologies were mapped to those available in USLCI.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: This dataset was developed by the Federal LCA Commons Data Curator Eastern Research Group, Inc. (ERG) under subcontract (SUB-2024-10066) to the National Renewable Energy Laboratory under Department of Energy (DOE) Prime Contract No. DE-AC36-08GO28308. The work is funded by DOE's Advanced Materials & Manufacturing Technologies Office (AMMTO).

reviews.details: ERG internally reviewed the programs, underlying assumptions, and mathematical operations required to produce the JSON-LD files for addition to USLCI.

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The uncertainty included in the CFS PUF was not captured.

sources.name: US Census Bureau (2017) CFS Public Use File
US Census Bureau (2017) CFS Public Use File User Guide

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This data represents the standard transportation technology used in the U.S. for all modes excluding pipeline. The current default provider for pipeline entries represent the transportation of crude petroleum which was selected as a proxy for SCTG Code 20 (Basic Chemicals) and SCTG Code 31 (Non-Metallic Minerals). Currently, there are no pipeline processes in USLCI that specifically relate to chemical or mineral transport.
processDocumentation.timeDescription: This process reflects a sample of four weeks of transportation activities, one week per quarter, over the course of 2017.
processDocumentation.useAdvice: These data are intended to be used as proxies for commodity specifc transport inputs when primary or more relevant data are not available. It is recommended that the user review the transportation modes present in each process and make a judgement call about which modes are relevant for the use case and which modes should be excluded. These processes only represent the domestic transport of commodities within the United States.
